Title: Update Travel Approval object's Search Layout and create a new List View for "Open Out of State Travel Requests"
Functional Specifications:
Create and Customize a List View


In your Dev2 Sandbox:


First, update the Search Layout for the Travel Approvals object.


> Click Search Layouts

> Click the down arrow for the Default Layout and select Edit from the dropdown.

> Use the Add arrow to move these fields into the Selected Fields column, in order.

---- Purpose of Trip

---- Department

---- Status

---- Destination State

---- Trip Start Date

---- Trip End Date

> Save


Next, ignore the changes prescribed for the "All" List View for Travel Approvals, since we've already made our own customizations, but go ahead and create the new List view for "Open Out of State Travel Requests" as prescribed.


Should have 2 Components in your Commit.


Promote & Deploy this US to DevMerge and then to QA; once those 2 forward Promotions have Completed Successfully, then verify that it is showing in the Pipeline Manager as available for Back Promotion to the "sibling" Dev Sandboxes, but do NOT Back Promote this US for now.

Title: Customize the Travel Approval Object Layout for new Business Requirements
Functional Specifications:
Customize the Travel Approval. Object Layout


These Requirements were gathered before Salesforce released their awesome new Lightning Dynamic Forms, so we are going to create a new Lightning Dynamic Form that embraces the Requirements gathered from our End Users, but makes the most of the Lightning User Experience.


In your Dev4 Sandbox:

> Go to Setup

> Go to the Travel Approvals Object

> Click Lightning Record Pages

> Click New

> Select Record Page

> Label = Travel Approvals

> Object = Travel Approval

> Select Template Grouped Header and Right Sidebar

> Click Finish


Ignore all of Salesforce's Pop-ups


Now, we are going to add other Components to this Lightning Record Page:


First, let's add our Fields from the Travel Approval Object


> Drag Record Detail onto the Page where the "Add Components Here" message is displayed; you will get a prompt on the right-side panel to try Dynamic Forms - click "Upgrade Now"

> Complete the Wizard and use all defaults they present you

> Remove the Additional Fields container

> Delete the component Record Detail - Mobile

> Within the Fields container - edit the Section Information:

--- Change the label of the Information Section to Travel Approval - General Details

--- Place the fields Travel Approval #, Owner, Status and Department in this Section, as shown in the original requirements

--- Remove all other fields from this Section

--- Click Save and dismiss the Warning; for Activate prompt, click "Not Yet"

> Within the Fields container - drag a new Field Section component beneathTravel Approval - General Details

--- Set the label of the new Section to Trip Info

--- Place the fields Purpose of Trip, Trip Start Date, Trip End Date, Out-of-State and Destination State in this Section, as shown in the original requirements

--- Click Save and dismiss the Warning; for Activate prompt, click "Not Yet"

> Within the Fields container - drag a new Field Section component beneathTrip Info

--- Set the label of the new Section to System Fields

--- Place the fields Created By and Last Modified By in this Section, as shown in the original requirements, and also add our custom field External Id beneath Created By


Since our Fields are now independent of any Page Layout, let's also make sure these critical Fields are flagged as Required in this Lightning Dynamic Form - Status, Department, Purpose of Trip, Destination State, Trip Start Date, Trip End Date.


Note: External Id is Required at the Field Definition, so is automatically required here as well.


Click Save; continue to dismiss any Warnings and any prompt to Activate.


Now that our Fields have been added, drag the Highlights Panel component to the very top of the Lightning Page and click "Upgrade Now"

> Remove all Actions except Post, Edit and Delete


Click Save; continue to dismiss any Warnings and any prompt to Activate.


Finally, let's drop our "Expense Items" Related List - Single component underneath the Highlights Panel and make it an Enhanced List


Click Save and this time, Activate the Lightning Dynamic Form; make sure to set it as an App Default for our Travel App, and your form factor needs only to be Desktop


Should have only 2 Components in your Commit.


Promote/Deploy to DevMerge, and once it is Completed Successfully, again to QA, but do not Back Promote to the "sibling" Dev Sandboxes just yet.

Title: Enable Chatter on the Travel Approval Object
Functional Specifications:
In your Dev3 Sandbox, Enable Chatter for Travel Approvals.


Should have only 1 Component in your Commit.


Promote/Deploy to DevMerge and then to QA. Do not Back Promote to "sibling" Dev Sandboxes just yet.


Test our changes in DevMerge and QA.

Title: Create 1 net-new Permission Set: Manage Travel App Objects' Records
Functional Specifications:
In Dev4, create a net-new Permission Set Manage Travel App Objects' Records and grant Full Permission to all Travel App Objects and their Fields.


In Dev4 Sandbox make sure you include the Permission Set Description as:


Assign to Users on the Bootcamp Standard Profile to extend Permissions on the Travel App Objects from Create/Read to Full Permission


Your Commit should include 1 Component, but which Git Operation do you use?

> Commit with only the new Permission Set?

> Commit with the new Permission Set as Select and the 3 Travel App Objects and their Fields as Retrieve-only?

> Full Profiles and Permission Set Commit with only the new Permission Set?


Why?


Is there more than 1 right answer?


Once you have confirmed your Feature Branch, Promote/Deploy to DevMerge and QA and Back Promote to "sibling" Devs

Title: Bootcamp Standard User - New Custom Profile:Â  See Functional Specifications
Functional Specifications:
In Dev3 Sandbox, since we know this Profile should have Minimum Access, other than our Travel App components, we will begin by Cloning the standard Minimum Access - Salesforce Profile.


This custom Profile should grant Create/Read Permissions on all Travel App Objects and Edit Permission on their Fields.


This custom Profile should grant Visibility of the Travel App custom App (as the default app) and its related Tabs.


This custom Profile should have the System Permissions "Lightning Experience User" and "Run Reports"


This custom Profile should grant NO other Permissions.


Since you are wholly creating a net-new Profile, which Git Operation should you use?


Is there more than one correct answer?


Since we have YAML in place to suppress userPermissions, we will need to do some quick post-Deployment Manual cleanup:

> Clear all editable System Permissions in Target Environment except for Lightning Experience User and Run Reports

> Clear all editable App Permissions in Target Environment



Additionally, some Standard Tabs are not passed in the API and simply default to "Default On" or "Default Off" - clean them up in Target Environment so that you only have the Tabs for your Travel App as "Default On" and all other Tabs are Hidden



Promote/Deploy to DevMerge and QA and Back Promote to all "sibling" Dev Sandboxes

Title: Travel App object is not Chatter Enabled in all Sandboxes
Functional Specifications:
Before beginning this Bug, make sure all previous USes that have gone to DevMerge have been Back Promoted to all "sibling" Dev Sandboxes.


Check all Dev Sandboxes, DevMerge and QA.


Troubleshoot, diagnose, solution.


Make corrections in Dev4 Sandbox.


Your Commit should include only 1 Component.


Promote/Deploy all the way up to QA and perform all Back Promotions to "sibling" Dev Sandboxes
